headline.print_headline: Thousands Protest Austerity Measures in Spain and Portugal
headline.seo: Thousands Protest Austerity Measures in Spain and Portugal
headline.main: Thousands Protest Austerity Measures in Spain and Portugal

docs.snippet: People from all over Spain rallied in the capital on Saturday against punishing austerity measures imposed by the government in response to the financial crisis....
docs.lead_paragraph: People from all over Spain rallied in the capital on Saturday against punishing austerity measures imposed by the government in response to the financial crisis.

headline.print_headline: Kick-Starts From a Phone and the Fed
headline.seo: From the Fed and Apple, a Possible Economic Lift
headline.main: Kick-Starts From a Phone and the Fed

docs.snippet: The economy could benefit from two very different events last week: the announcement of the Federal Reserve’s latest bond-buying plan and Apple’s introduction of the iPhone 5....
docs.abstract: Jeff Sommer Strategies column holds the economy could benefit from two very different events: Federal Reserve's announcement of its latest bond-buying plan and Apple’s introduction of the iPhone 5; maintains Fed's ambitious plan is by far the riskiest of the two, and Apple, by contrast, is operating from a position of strength.
docs.lead_paragraph: The economy could benefit from two very different events last week: the announcement of the Federal Reserve’s latest bond-buying plan and Apple’s introduction of the iPhone 5.

docs.snippet: The recession and its aftermath spell insecurity and hardship for millions of Americans....
docs.abstract: Editorial laments that neither presidential candidate is addressing the fact that millions of Americans are headed for insecure retirements; calls for strengthening and preserving Social Security, as well as proposals for new forms of retirement coverage.
docs.lead_paragraph: The recession and its aftermath spell insecurity and hardship for millions of Americans.

headline.print_headline: Berlusconi Magazine to Publish Duchess Photos
headline.seo: Berlusconi’s Magazine Chi to Publish Topless Duchess Photos
headline.main: Berlusconi Magazine to Publish Duchess Photos

docs.snippet: The images of Kate Middleton sunbathing topless first appeared in the French magazine Closer, which is also owned by former Italian Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi’s Mondadori group....
docs.abstract: Italian magazine Chi owned by former Prime Min Silvio Berlusconi announces plans to publish photographs of the former Kate Middleton, the Duchess of Cambridge, sunbathing topless, just as its sister French magazine Closer did.

byline.contributor: Ravi Somaiya contributed reporting from London.

docs.lead_paragraph: The images of Kate Middleton sunbathing topless first appeared in the French magazine Closer, which is also owned by former Italian Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi’s Mondadori group.

headline.seo: Myanmar Activist Says He’s Canceling Trip to U.S.

docs.snippet: A prominent activist is canceling a trip to the United States to receive a democracy award, to show solidarity with colleagues whose passports have apparently been denied....
docs.abstract: Min Ko Naing, prominent activist in Myanmar, is canceling a trip to the United States to receive a democracy award, to show solidarity with colleagues whose passports have apparently been denied.
docs.lead_paragraph: A prominent activist is canceling a trip to the United States to receive a democracy award, to show solidarity with colleagues whose passports have apparently been denied.

headline.print_headline: World Hunger: The Problem Left Behind
headline.seo: World Hunger, the Problem Left Behind - Economic View
headline.main: World Hunger: The Problem Left Behind

docs.snippet: Economic gains in many sectors have yet to solve the problem of feeding the world. In Africa alone, government policies and fertilizer costs are inhibiting agricultural progress....
docs.abstract: Tyler Cowen Economic View column contends drought-induced run-up in corn prices is a reminder that the problem of world hunger is nowhere near solved; holds price surge, third major international food price spike in last five years, belies the assumption that widespread economic development leads to corresponding gains in agriculture; argues in Africa, government policies and fertilizer costs are inhibiting agricultural progress.
docs.lead_paragraph: Economic gains in many sectors have yet to solve the problem of feeding the world. In Africa alone, government policies and fertilizer costs are inhibiting agricultural progress.

headline.print_headline: Afghans Act to Fill Top Security Posts
headline.main: Afghans Act to Fill Top Security Posts

docs.snippet: Afghan lawmakers approved all three of President Hamid Karzai’s nominees for the government’s top security jobs on Saturday, avoiding a prolonged power vacuum....
docs.abstract: Afghan lawmakers approve all three of Pres Hamid Karzai’s nominees for the government’s top security jobs, avoiding a prolonged power vacuum as country confronts multiple reminders of the fragility of its security.

byline.contributor: An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting.

docs.lead_paragraph: Afghan lawmakers approved all three of President Hamid Karzai’s nominees for the government’s top security jobs on Saturday, avoiding a prolonged power vacuum.

headline.main: Sometimes, a Candidate Is Meant to Look Plastic

docs.snippet: Those cashing in on the Republican and Democratic conventions included vendors selling pins, T-shirts and dolls. Will saving these trifles make anyone rich in the future?...

headline.seo: Young Afghan Lives, Lost in the Fog of War
headline.main: Young Lives, Lost in the Fog of War

docs.snippet: Indiscriminate suicide bombings are robbing Afghanistan’s children of their dreams....
docs.abstract: Innocent children are among the victims of indiscriminate suicide bombings in Afghanistan, which has one of the world’s highest population growth rates, and children are thick on the ground in any public place; 865 civilians were killed or wounded in suicide or other bombings in the first eight months of 2012, 38 percent of them children.
docs.lead_paragraph: Indiscriminate suicide bombings are robbing Afghanistan’s children of their dreams.
